div.p: J.L.Dodds
Truck Co # 8-23 Engrs
Miss Ellen Smith
111 Hatton Street
Jackson Tennessee
U.S.A.
Dear Ellen
Just recieved a bunch of mail last night with four letters from some old and some new altho I enjoyed them all. This leaves me o.k. and hope you are
fine and dondy
Well it is trying to rain here to day of course that is nothing unusual for this country.
But if this mud get murch deeper I dont know how - I will ever get any where with my truck I was out yesterday and of course I was stuck twice and felt like was lucky them to get by so easy
They are still driving the Germans back and I hope they were continues to do so I thank this war is all over but the shouting
Every body has quit but German and we will make hur quit soon Say the letter that you and Esther wrote just arrived.
I can tell from the way she writes she thank therre is no one like Cecil Well cant blame hur.
I know your was glad to see hur come back. Only wish I could have been there to take in some of the dances with you.
I guess i will have to learn how to dance for has been so long sence I dance any.
I will soon be gone a year and seems like at least five
How about you?
Well I thank will soon come back to U.S.
You should be over here with me. I would let you sit in
a German chair Orr brought them in last night from the front we have chairs table abig mirror and some other things that just a few days ago belong to the Germans

If they will just let us tary here long enough we will be fixed up like home. This is some bunch want take a thing that weighs more than a tone I would have liked to been at the fair even if it wasnt good
Some say it was good and others say it wasnt, well it doesnt matter I wasnt there I want know the difference long
Say I sure was glad to get the picture. make me real hom sick though
The boys are all laughing at me about that friend of your
they tell me he will have you and gone before I can get back. Well I hope not,
Now what do you say about it you know I will have to leave that to you. I am going to believe you will be there when I get back any way.
I tell them that Mr Bamon is not the fellow I fear the most.
Well you know who the other one is. Far I know how he use to be when I was home.
Well I say I will be on the look out for Harold and him sure would like to see them both.

But a fellow is lucky when he finds some on like that for their are so many of us soliders over here I would like to tell you where I am but that is out of the question. so can tell you all about it when I get home.
So Aunt Annie got married at last. Well I hate to here of that cause I cant keep a check on you so easy.
So you are a country girl now will I remember how I use to hate to see you go to the county
Well Orr has got the broom and going to sweep out the leave so will have to quit for this time
write me real often and tell me all the news you can thank of
with love
James. L. Dodds
Truck company #8 - 23th Enger
American Exp Force
Via NY. France
